Name: Technical amendments to section 24-163.1 of such code.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to technical amendments to section 24-163.1 of such code.

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Committee approved by Roll Call.
A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
This Introduction was Sent to Mayor by Council
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Mayor
This Introduction was Signed Into Law by Mayor
This Introduction was Recved from Mayor by Council

RTF:
{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252\deff0\deflang1033\deflangfe1033{\fonttbl{\f0\froman\fprq2\fcharset0 Times New Roman;}}
\viewkind4\uc1
\ul\v0\par
Be it enacted by the Council as follows\ulnone :\par
\i\par
\pard\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj\i0 Section 1. Paragraph two of subdivision d of section 24-163.1 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended to read as follows:  \par
(2) The city shall achieve the following minimum percentage increases in the average fuel economy of all light-duty vehicles purchased by the city during the following fiscal years, relative to the average fuel economy of all such vehicles purchased by the city during the fiscal year beginning July 1, 2004, calculated pursuant to paragraph one of this subdivision:\par
\pard{\pntext\f0 (i)\tab}{\*\pn\pnlvlbody\pnf0\pnindent360\pnstart1\pnlcrm{\pntxtb(}{\pntxta)}}
\fi-720\li1440\sl480\slmult1\qj\tx1440 For the fiscal year beginning July 1, 2006, five percent;\par
{\pntext\f0 (ii)\tab}For the fiscal year beginning July 1, 2007, eight percent;\par
{\pntext\f0 (iii)\tab}For the fiscal year beginning July 1, 2008, ten percent; \par
{\pntext\f0 (iv)\tab}For the fiscal year beginning July 1, 2009, twelve percent; \par
{\pntext\f0 (v)\tab}For the fiscal year\ul s\ulnone  beginning July 1, 2010[,] \ul and July 1, 2011,\ulnone  fifteen percent;\par
{\pntext\f0 (vi)\tab}For the fiscal year\ul s\ulnone  beginning July 1, 2012, \ul July 1, 2013 and July 1, 2014, \ulnone eighteen percent; and\par
{\pntext\f0 (vii)\tab}For the fiscal year beginning July 1, 2015, and for each fiscal year thereafter, twenty percent.\par
\pard\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj\'a72. Subdivision g of section 24-163.1 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended to read as follows:  \par
g. This section shall not apply:\par
(1) where federal or state funding precludes the city from imposing the purchasing requirements of this section; \ul\par
\ulnone (2) to purchases that are emergency procurements pursuant to section three hundred fifteen of the charter; or\ul\par
\ulnone (3) except for subdivision f of this section, to diesel fuel-powered motor vehicles subject to \ul paragraph two of subdivision b of\ulnone  section 24-163.4 of this chapter.\par
\'a73. This local law shall take effect immediately upon its enactment.\ul\par
\pard\sl480\slmult1\qj\ulnone\par
